dc_title_s: A new chart of the coast of New England, Nova Scotia, New France or Canada
dc_description_s: Extent: 1 map | Abstract: Map showing the Maritime Provinces, Newfoundland, part of Labrador, part of New England to Boston, and the St. Lawrence Valley region to Quebec City. Emphasizes coastal details. | Notes: Depths shown by soundings.|Prime meridian: London.|Orginally published in January 1746 issue of: Gentleman's magazine. London : Printed by Edw. Cave.|Map is described on pages 71-77 of February 1746 issue of Gentleman's magazine.|Includes 4 insets: North Atlantic Ocean -- Plan of the city and port of Louisbourg -- Fort Dauphin -- City of Quebec.|Accompanied by p. 71-78 from the February 1746 issue in vol. 16 of The Gentleman's Magazine.|From: Gentleman's Magazine, vol. 16, January 1746. (MUN RARE AP 2 G4, lacks copy of map). | Scale approximately 1:3,500,000
